## Packages ğŸ“¦

Packages are like magic toolboxes ğŸ§° that contain a collection of functions for specific needs. We want to make sure that everyone has the necessary packages installed for this workshop.

### Install packages 

Let's create a list of packages that we'll need from CRAN. Here they are:

```{r}
#| label: chunk-pkg-list
#| output: false 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
package_list <-
  c(
    "ape",
    "fs",
    "geiger",
    "geojsonsf",
    "here",
    "httpgd",
    "janitor",
    "jsonlite",
    "knitr",
    "languageserver",
    "neotoma2",
    "palmerpenguins",
    "phytools",
    "picante",
    "quarto",
    "renv",
    "remotes",
    "rlang",
    "sdm",
    "targets",
    "terra",
    "tidyverse",
    "tinytable",
    "usethis",
    "utils",
    "visNetwork",
    "torch",
    "cito",
    "vegan"
  )
```

Now, let's install all these amazing packages from CRAN:

```{r}
#| label: chunk-pkg-install
#| eval: false
lapply(
  package_list, utils::install.packages
)
```


### Test if all packages are ready âœ…

Let's do a quick test to make sure everything is in order. Running the following code should produce `"Everything is good to go"` instead of an error message saying `"All required packages are not installed"`.

```{r}
#| label: chunk-pkg-test
#| eval: false
if (
  isTRUE(
    all(
      package_list %in%
        as.data.frame(
          utils::installed.packages()
        )[, 1]
    )
  )
) {
  cat("Everything is good to go")
} else {
  warning("All required packages are not installed")
  warning(
    paste(
      "Please install the following packages:",
      paste(
        setdiff(
          package_list,
          as.data.frame(
            utils::installed.packages()
          )[, 1]
        ),
        collapse = ", "
      )
    )
  )
}
```
